paragraph_1: Twas brillig, and the slithy toves,
Did gyre and gimble in the wabe:
paragraph_2: The jaws that bite, the claws that catch!
Beware the Jubjub bird, and shun
paragraph_3: He took his vorpal sword in hand:
Long time the manxome foe he sought --
So rested he by the Tumtum tree,
paragraph_4: And, as in uffish thought he stood,
The Jabberwock, with eyes of flame,
Came whiffling through the tulgey wood,
paragraph_5: One, two! One, two! And through and through
He left it dead, and with its head
paragraph_6: And, has thou slain the Jabberwock?
Come to my arms, my beamish boy!
